query: I'm Marcus, 42. Diagnosed with hypertension. What's the usual first medication?
report: Thiazide diuretics like Hydrochlorothiazide or ACE inhibitors like Lisinopril are common first-line treatments for high blood pressure.

query: My name is Lena, 35. I have bacterial pneumonia. What antibiotic is standard?
report: Community-acquired pneumonia is typically treated with Amoxicillin, Doxycycline, or respiratory Fluoroquinolones like Levofloxacin.

query: I'm Victor, 58. Diagnosed with type 2 diabetes. What's the first medication tried?
report: Metformin is the first-line medication for type 2 diabetes, helping improve insulin sensitivity.

query: My name is Clara, 29. I have migraine headaches. What abortive medication?
report: Triptans like Sumatriptan or Rizatriptan are first-line for acute migraine attacks.

query: I'm Oscar, 67. Diagnosed with COPD. What maintenance inhaler?
report: Long-acting bronchodilators like Tiotropium or combination inhalers with corticosteroids are standard for COPD maintenance.

query: My name is Nina, 44. I have rheumatoid arthritis. What DMARD?
report: Methotrexate is typically the first disease-modifying antirheumatic drug for rheumatoid arthritis.

query: I'm Julian, 51. Diagnosed with acid reflux. What PPI?
report: Omeprazole, Esomeprazole, or Pantoprazole are common proton pump inhibitors for GERD.

query: My name is Iris, 38. I have urinary tract infection. What antibiotic?
report: Nitrofurantoin or Trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole are first-line for uncomplicated UTIs.

query: I'm Simon, 63. Diagnosed with atrial fibrillation. What anticoagulant?
report: Direct oral anticoagulants like Apixaban or Dabigatran are commonly used for stroke prevention in AFib.

query: My name is Elise, 47. I have osteoporosis. What bisphosphonate?
report: Alendronate is a common first-line bisphosphonate for osteoporosis treatment.

query: I'm Felix, 32. I have strep throat. What antibiotic?
report: Penicillin or Amoxicillin are standard treatments for streptococcal pharyngitis.

query: My name is Ada, 56. I have shingles. What antiviral?
report: Acyclovir, Valacyclovir, or Famciclovir are prescribed for herpes zoster to reduce duration and severity.

query: I'm Walter, 61. Diagnosed with gout. What for acute attack?
report: NSAIDs like Indomethacin, Colchicine, or corticosteroids are used for acute gout pain.

query: My name is Cora, 41. I have depression. What SSRI?
report: Sertraline, Escitalopram, or Fluoxetine are common first-line SSRIs for depression.

query: I'm Hugo, 53. Diagnosed with BPH. What alpha-blocker?
report: Tamsulosin or Alfuzosin are alpha-blockers commonly used for benign prostatic hyperplasia symptoms.

query: My name is Vera, 36. I have hypothyroidism. What replacement?
report: Levothyroxine is the standard thyroid hormone replacement therapy.

query: I'm Leon, 59. Diagnosed with psoriasis. What topical treatment?
report: Topical corticosteroids like Triamcinolone or Vitamin D analogs like Calcipotriene are first-line.

query: My name is Maya, 45. I have anxiety disorder. What medication?
report: SSRIs like Sertraline or SNRIs like Venlafaxine are first-line for anxiety disorders.

query: I'm Otto, 68. Diagnosed with Parkinson's. What dopamine therapy?
report: Levodopa-carbidopa is the primary treatment for Parkinson's disease motor symptoms.

query: My name is Ruth, 39. I have birth control needs. What options?
report: Combination oral contraceptives, progestin-only pills, or long-acting reversible contraceptives are common choices.

query: I have a headache. Can I take Ibuprofen?
report: Yes, Ibuprofen is an effective OTC option for tension headaches in adults when used as directed.

query: My name is Anton, 48. I have heartburn. Can I take Tums?
report: Yes, Calcium carbonate antacids like Tums are appropriate for occasional mild heartburn.

query: I'm Greta, 33. I have seasonal allergies. Is Loratadine safe daily?
report: Yes, Loratadine is a non-sedating antihistamine safe for daily use during allergy season.

query: My name is Lars, 57. I have toenail fungus. Can I use topical Terbinafine?
report: Topical antifungals have limited nail penetration. Oral Terbinafine is more effective for fungal nails.

query: I'm Heidi, 26. I have menstrual cramps. Is Naproxen appropriate?
report: Yes, Naproxen is excellent for menstrual cramps as it reduces prostaglandin production.

query: My name is Emil, 52. I have back pain. Can I take Aspirin?
report: Yes, Aspirin can help mild back pain, though NSAIDs like Ibuprofen may be more effective.

query: I'm Frieda, 64. I have arthritis pain. Is Acetaminophen safe?
report: Yes, Acetaminophen is first-line for osteoarthritis pain when used at recommended doses.

query: My name is Klaus, 43. I have poison oak rash. Can I use Hydrocortisone?
report: Yes, OTC Hydrocortisone cream can help relieve itching from poison oak dermatitis.

query: I'm Anna, 31. I have canker sore. Is Orajel safe to use?
report: Yes, Benzocaine products like Orajel provide temporary pain relief for canker sores.

query: My name is Erik, 49. I have constipation. Is Docusate sodium okay?
report: Yes, Docusate is a gentle stool softener appropriate for occasional constipation.

query: I'm Ingrid, 28. I have motion sickness. Can I take Dramamine?
report: Yes, Dimenhydrinate is effective for motion sickness prevention when taken before travel.

query: My name is Stefan, 55. I have hemorrhoids. Is Preparation H appropriate?
report: Yes, Preparation H with Hydrocortisone is suitable for short-term hemorrhoid symptom relief.

query: I'm Marta, 37. I have cold sores. Is Abreva effective?
report: Yes, Docosanol cream can reduce healing time when applied at first sign of outbreak.

query: My name is Karl, 46. I have athlete's foot. Can I use Lotrimin?
report: Yes, Clotrimazole is an effective OTC antifungal for athlete's foot.

query: I'm Lena, 34. I have dandruff. Is Head & Shoulders okay?
report: Yes, Pyrithione zinc shampoo is effective for common dandruff with regular use.

query: My name is Hans, 58. I have acid reflux. Is Pepcid AC safe?
report: Yes, Famotidine is safe for occasional heartburn relief.

query: I'm Gisela, 42. I have dry eyes. Are artificial tears safe?
report: Yes, preservative-free artificial tears are safe for regular dry eye use.

query: My name is Werner, 61. I have bronchitis cough. Is Robitussin DM okay?
report: Yes, Dextromethorphan can help suppress cough from bronchitis.

query: I'm Sabine, 29. I have sunburn. Can I use Aloe Vera gel?
report: Yes, Aloe Vera can soothe sunburn, but avoid products with added anesthetics.

query: My name is Dieter, 53. I have nasal congestion. Is Afrin safe?
report: Oxymetazoline should only be used for 3 days maximum to avoid rebound congestion.

query: I'm Ute, 39. I have vaginal itching. Is Monistat appropriate?
report: Yes, if you've had diagnosed yeast infections before, OTC Miconazole is appropriate.

query: My name is Franz, 50. I have muscle strain. Is Bengay safe?
report: Yes, topical Menthol products are safe for muscle pain relief.

query: I'm Helga, 44. I have cold symptoms. Is DayQuil safe?
report: Yes, but check for interactions with other medications and avoid with uncontrolled hypertension.

query: My name is Rolf, 47. I have high cholesterol. My Atorvastatin is expensive. Cheaper option?
report: Generic Atorvastatin is now available. Also ask about other statins like Simvastatin which may be lower cost.

query: I'm Petra, 62. My Eliquis costs too much. Any alternative?
report: Warfarin is a much cheaper anticoagulant but requires regular blood monitoring and dietary consistency.

query: My name is Gustav, 55. My Advair is expensive. Cheaper version?
report: Generic Fluticasone/Salmeterol dry powder inhalers are now available at lower cost.

query: I'm Hilda, 41. My Imitrex for migraines is costly. Options?
report: Generic Sumatriptan is available. Other triptans like Rizatriptan may have different pricing.

query: My name is Johann, 67. My Xarelto is unaffordable. Alternative?
report: Warfarin is a low-cost alternative but requires frequent INR testing.

query: I'm Karin, 48. My Synthroid is brand-only expensive. Generic?
report: Generic Levothyroxine is widely available and equally effective for hypothyroidism.

query: My name is Manfred, 59. My Spiriva is costly. Cheaper alternative?
report: Generic Tiotropium is now available at lower cost than brand Spiriva.

query: I'm Renate, 36. My Latisse is expensive. Any option?
report: Bimatoprost has no OTC equivalent. Discuss prescription alternatives with your ophthalmologist.

query: My name is Ulrich, 63. My Namenda for dementia is costly. Generic?
report: Generic Memantine is available and significantly cheaper than brand Namenda.

query: I'm Monika, 45. My NuvaRing is expensive. Cheaper birth control?
report: Generic oral contraceptives or contraceptive patches are usually more affordable options.

query: I was prescribed Prednisone but worried about weight gain. Is this normal?
report: Weight gain and fluid retention are common side effects of corticosteroids, usually temporary with short-term use.

query: My name is Gerhard, 58. My doctor wants me on Statin but I fear muscle pain.
report: Muscle pain is a known side effect. Your doctor can start with a low dose and switch to better-tolerated statins if needed.

query: I'm Brigitte, 70. I need antidepressant but worried about nausea.
report: SSRIs can cause initial nausea that often subsides. Taking with food and starting low can minimize this.

query: My name as is Kurt, 45. Metformin causes stomach issues. Normal?
report: GI upset is very common when starting Metformin. Taking with meals or extended-release formulation can help.

query: I'm Ilse, 33. Prescribed Isotretinoin for acne but worried about dryness.
report: Severe dryness is expected. Intensive moisturizing and lip balm are essential during treatment.

query: My name is Friedrich, 52. My blood pressure med causes cough. Normal?
report: Dry cough is a common side effect of ACE inhibitors. Your doctor can switch you to an ARB.

query: I'm Anke, 41. My antidepressant makes me jittery. Concern?
report: Agitation can occur with some antidepressants. Dose adjustment or medication change may help.

query: My name is Bernd, 63. My diabetes drug causes UTIs. Risk?
report: SGLT2 inhibitors do increase UTI risk. Good hygiene and hydration are important preventive measures.

query: I'm Christa, 29. My birth control causes mood swings. Normal?
report: Mood changes can occur with hormonal contraceptives. A different formulation may be better tolerated.

query: My name is Detlef, 57. My prostate drug causes dizziness. Concern?
report: Dizziness is common with alpha-blockers. Rise slowly from sitting or lying position.

query: My 3-year-old has fever. Can I give her a small piece of adult Tylenol?
report: No, this is dangerous. Use only infant Acetaminophen and measure dose precisely by weight with provided syringe.

query: My 11-year-old son has pink eye. Can I use leftover antibiotic drops?
report: No, never use old medication. Pink eye requires proper diagnosis and fresh prescription if bacterial.

query: My 7-year-old daughter has cough. Is children's Delsym safe?
report: Yes, children's Dextromethorphan is generally safe when following age and weight-based dosing.

query: My 16-year-old has severe acne. Can I buy her Differin gel?
report: Yes, Adapalene (Differin) is now available OTC and is appropriate for adolescent acne.

query: My 9-year-old has strep throat. What antibiotic dosage?
report: Amoxicillin is commonly prescribed with dosage based precisely on the child's weight.

query: My 5-year-old has ear infection. Can I use my Amoxicillin?
report: No, never give adult medication to a child. Pediatric doses are weight-based and require proper calculation.

query: My 13-year-old has allergies. Is children's Zyrtec safe daily?
report: Yes, Cetirizine is safe for children when using pediatric formulation and proper dosing.

query: My 4-year-old has constipation. Is pediatric glycerin suppository safe?
report: Yes, pediatric glycerin suppositories are safe for occasional constipation relief.

query: My 8-year-old has head lice. Is Nix treatment safe?
report: Yes, Permethrin is FDA-approved for children 2 months and older when used as directed.

query: My 6-year-old has asthma. Can I give her my Albuterol inhaler?
report: No, pediatric asthma requires proper diagnosis and age-appropriate delivery devices.

query: I have anxiety but don't want prescriptions. Is Valerian Root effective?
report: Valerian is used for sleep, not acute anxiety. L-Theanine or therapy are better natural options.

query: My name is Gustav, 65. I have arthritis pain. Are Turmeric supplements good?
report: Turmeric may have mild anti-inflammatory effects but is not as potent as prescription NSAIDs.

query: I'm Helene, 40. I have trouble focusing. Is Ginkgo Biloba helpful?
report: Evidence for Ginkgo's cognitive benefits in healthy people is limited. Address sleep and stress first.

query: I'm Ludwig, 52. Can I use St. John's Wort for mild depression?
report: Caution: St. John's Wort has serious drug interactions. Consult doctor before use.

query: I'm Margot, 35. I have insomnia. Is Melatonin safe long-term?
report: Melatonin is generally safe for short-term use. Address underlying sleep issues for chronic insomnia.

query: My name is Otto, 45. I have hot flashes. Is black cohosh effective?
report: Black cohosh may help some women, but evidence is mixed and product quality varies.

query: I'm Paul, 58. I have enlarged prostate. Is saw palmetto effective?
report: Studies show saw palmetto is no more effective than placebo for BPH symptoms.

query: My name as is Rosa, 33. I have UTI. Can cranberry pills cure it?
report: Cranberry may help prevention but cannot cure active infection. Antibiotics are required.

query: I'm Siegfried, 49. I have high cholesterol. Are red yeast rice supplements good?
report: Red yeast rice contains natural statins but dosage is unregulated. Prescription statins provide controlled treatment.

query: My name is Trude, 42. I have migraines. Is butterbur effective?
report: Butterbur has evidence for migraine prevention but must be PA-free due to liver toxicity concerns.

query: I'm Wilhelm, 67. I take Warfarin. I sprained my ankle. Can I take Ibuprofen?
report: No, Ibuprofen significantly increases bleeding risk with Warfarin. Acetaminophen is safer.

query: My name is Elsa, 55. I take Metoprolol. I have a cold. Can I take Sudafed?
report: Pseudoephedrine can counteract Metoprolol. Saline nasal spray is safer.

query: I'm Franziska, 72. I take Levothyroxine. I have acid reflux. Can I take Omeprazole?
report: Yes, but take at least 4 hours apart. PPIs can interfere with Levothyroxine absorption.

query: I'm Gunther, 60. I take HCTZ. I have diarrhea. Can I take Loperamide?
report: Yes, but focus on hydration with electrolytes since both can cause dehydration.

query: My name is Hedwig, 68. I'm on Coumadin. Can I take Aspirin for headache?
report: No, Aspirin increases bleeding risk. Acetaminophen is safer for pain relief.

query: I'm Ingo, 57. I take Lisinopril. Can I take Naproxen for back pain?
report: NSAIDs can reduce antihypertensive effect and harm kidneys. Acetaminophen is preferred.

query: My name is Jutta, 63. I take Synthroid. Can I take calcium supplements?
report: Yes, but take at least 4 hours apart. Calcium can interfere with absorption.

query: I'm Klaus, 59. I take Plavix. Can I take Prilosec for heartburn?
report: Omeprazole may reduce Clopidogrel effectiveness. Famotidine is a safer alternative.

query: I'm always tired and cold. My sister takes thyroid medicine. Should I get same?
report: Your symptoms could indicate hypothyroidism. Ask your doctor for TSH blood test before considering medication.

query: My name is Lars, 50. I have tingling feet. My diabetic friend takes Gabapentin. Do I need that?
report: Tingling has many causes. A doctor must diagnose neuropathy cause before considering Gabapentin.

query: I'm Nadine, 28. I have bloating after eating. My mom takes IBS medicine. Should I try that?
report: Bloating could be IBS, lactose intolerance, or other issues. See doctor for proper diagnosis first.

query: I'm Oliver, 45. I have trouble urinating. My father took prostate medicine. Should I start that?
report: Urinary symptoms require prostate exam and PSA test to confirm BPH before starting medications.

query: My name is Paula, 35. I'm always tired. My friend takes B12 shots. Should I get them?
report: Get B12 levels tested first. Often fatigue is from other causes like sleep issues or stress.

query: I have a UTI. Can I take Ciprofloxacin from my old prescription?
report: No, never use old antibiotics. Current infection may be resistant. Need new prescription.

query: My name is Rainer, 41. I have sinus infection. Can I take my daughter's Amoxicillin?
report: Absolutely not. Never use anyone else's prescription. Dose is incorrect for adult.

query: I'm Sabrina, 65. I have toothache. Can I take leftover Vicodin from surgery?
report: No, opioids not appropriate for toothache and carry addiction risk. See dentist for proper treatment.

query: I'm Thomas, 20. I have jock itch. Can I use same Clotrimazole as athlete's foot?
report: Yes, Clotrimazole is effective against both jock itch and athlete's foot fungi.

query: My name as is Ursula, 29. I have UTI symptoms. Can I take my old Cipro?
report: No, complete full course when prescribed. Old antibiotics may not match current infection.

query: I'm pretty sure I have hemorrhoids. Can I get Preparation H at drugstore?
report: Yes, for mild self-diagnosed hemorrhoids, OTC creams with hydrocortisone are appropriate short-term.

query: My name is Vanessa, 33. I think I have bladder infection. Can I get AZO pills?
report: AZO only numbs pain but doesn't treat infection. You need antibiotics from doctor for UTI.

query: I'm Wolfgang, 18. I have dandruff. Is Head & Shoulders the right medicine?
report: Yes, Pyrithione zinc shampoo is effective first-line OTC treatment for common dandruff.

query: My name is Yvonne, 55. I have wrist pain from typing. Can I use splint and Ibuprofen?
report: Yes, wrist splint and OTC Ibuprofen are standard initial self-care for suspected carpal tunnel.

query: I'm Zacharias, 26. I'm pretty sure I have hemorrhoids. Can I get Preparation H?
report: Yes, for mild self-diagnosed hemorrhoids, OTC creams with hydrocortisone are appropriate.

query: My name is Astrid, 29. I think I have UTI. Can I get cranberry pills?
report: Cranberry may help prevention but cannot cure active UTI. You need antibiotics.

query: I'm Bastian, 22. I have athlete's foot. Can I get Lotrimin at pharmacy?
report: Yes, Clotrimazole is effective OTC antifungal for athlete's foot when used as directed.

query: My name is Cornelia, 44. I think I have sinus infection. Can I get Sudafed?
report: Sudafed can relieve congestion but doesn't treat infection. See doctor if symptoms persist.

query: I'm Dirk, 35. I'm pretty sure I have jock itch. Can I use antifungal cream?
report: Yes, OTC antifungal creams are appropriate for self-treated jock itch.

query: I'm Elias, 48. Diagnosed with peripheral neuropathy. What medication for nerve pain?
report: Gabapentin, Pregabalin, or Duloxetine are commonly used for neuropathic pain.

query: My name is Fiona, 37. I have bipolar disorder. What mood stabilizer first?
report: Lithium or Valproate are first-line mood stabilizers for bipolar disorder.

query: I'm Gregor, 59. Diagnosed with sleep apnea. What treatment options?
report: CPAP therapy is first-line. Oral appliances or surgery are alternatives for some patients.

query: My name as is Helena, 42. I have Crohn's disease. What biologic medication?
report: Anti-TNF agents like Infliximab or Adalimumab are used for moderate-severe Crohn's.

query: I'm Isidor, 66. Diagnosed with wet macular degeneration. What injection?
report: Anti-VEGF injections like Ranibizumab or Aflibercept are standard treatment.

query: My name is Johanna, 51. I have overactive bladder. What anticholinergic?
report: Oxybutynin, Tolterodine, or Solifenacin are anticholinergics for overactive bladder.

query: I'm Konstantin, 57. Diagnosed with hepatitis C. What direct-acting antiviral?
report: Sofosbuvir/Velpatasvir or Glecaprevir/Pibrentasvir are common DAA regimens.

query: My name is Larissa, 44. I have lupus. What hydroxychloroquine dose?
report: Hydroxychloroquine is weight-based, typically 400mg daily for average-weight adults.

query: I'm Maximilian, 69. Diagnosed with myeloma. What proteasome inhibitor?
report: Bortezomib or Carfilzomib are proteasome inhibitors used in multiple myeloma.

query: My name is Nora, 38. I have endometriosis. What GnRH agonist?
report: Leuprolide is commonly used, typically with add-back hormone therapy.

query: I'm Orlando, 62. Diagnosed with pulmonary fibrosis. What antifibrotic?
report: Pirfenidone or Nintedanib are approved antifibrotic medications.

query: My name is Penelope, 47. I have fibromyalgia. What medication first?
report: Duloxetine, Milnacipran, or Pregabalin are first-line for fibromyalgia.

query: I'm Quentin, 71. Diagnosed with Parkinson's. What for tremor?
report: Levodopa is primary, but anticholinergics or beta-blockers may help specific tremor.

query: My name is Ramona, 53. I have chronic migraine. What preventive?
report: Topiramate, Propranolol, or CGRP monoclonal antibodies for chronic migraine prevention.

query: I'm Silas, 58. Diagnosed with prostate cancer. What hormone therapy?
report: GnRH agonists like Leuprolide or Goserelin are used for androgen deprivation.

query: My name is Tabea, 41. I have rheumatoid arthritis. What biologic?
report: TNF inhibitors like Etanercept or Adalimumab are common first biologics.

query: I'm Uwe, 64. Diagnosed with COPD exacerbation. What steroid dose?
report: Prednisone 40mg daily for 5-14 days is standard for COPD exacerbations.

query: My name is Viola, 49. I have osteoporosis. What anabolic agent?
report: Teriparatide or Romosozumab are anabolic treatments for severe osteoporosis.

query: I'm Willi, 72. Diagnosed with heart failure. What SGLT2 inhibitor?
report: Dapagliflozin or Empagliflozin are now standard for heart failure regardless of diabetes.

query: My name is Xenia, 46. I have ulcerative colitis. What aminosalicylate?
report: Mesalamine is first-line, available oral or rectal depending on disease extent.

query: I'm Yannick, 61. Diagnosed with gout. What urate-lowering therapy?
report: Allopurinol or Febuxostat are used for long-term urate lowering in recurrent gout.

query: My name is Zara, 39. I have epilepsy. What broad-spectrum anticonvulsant?
report: Levetiracetam, Lamotrigine, or Topiramate are broad-spectrum options.

query: I'm Aaron, 54. Diagnosed with shingles. What for postherpetic neuralgia?
report: Gabapentin, Pregabalin, or topical Lidocaine for postherpetic neuralgia pain.

query: My name is Bianca, 43. I have PCOS. What metformin dose?
report: Typically starts 500mg daily, may increase to 1500-2000mg based on tolerance.

query: I'm Cedric, 67. Diagnosed with low testosterone. What replacement?
report: Testosterone gel, injections, or pellets for confirmed hypogonadism.

query: My name is Daria, 52. I have hot flashes. What non-hormonal option?
report: SSRIs like Paroxetine or Gabapentin can reduce menopausal hot flashes.

query: I'm Enzo, 57. Diagnosed with angina. What nitrate?
report: Nitroglycerin sublingual for acute attacks; long-acting for prevention.

query: My name as is Fatima, 45. I have migraine with aura. What triptan?
report: Triptans are generally safe with aura if taken after headache onset, not during aura.

query: I'm Gianni, 63. Diagnosed with BPH. What 5-alpha reductase inhibitor?
report: Finasteride or Dutasteride reduce prostate size over months.

query: My name is Hana, 48. I have rheumatoid arthritis. What JAK inhibitor?
report: Tofacitinib or Baricitinib for moderate-severe RA after DMARD failure.

query: I'm Igor, 70. Diagnosed with Parkinson's. What MAO-B inhibitor?
report: Rasagiline or Selegiline as monotherapy or adjunct to Levodopa.

query: My name is Jasmine, 41. I have chronic pain. What SNRI?
report: Duloxetine or Milnacipran are SNRIs used for chronic pain conditions.

query: I'm Kaito, 58. Diagnosed with HIV. What INSTI regimen?
report: Bictegravir/Emtricitabine/Tenofovir or Dolutegravir-based regimens are first-line.

query: My name is Lila, 50. I have osteopenia. What treatment?
report: Calcium, Vitamin D, and exercise first. Medication if high fracture risk.

query: I'm Marco, 65. Diagnosed with AFib. What rate control medication?
report: Beta-blockers like Metoprolol or Calcium channel blockers like Diltiazem.

query: My name is Nala, 47. I have psoriasis. What biologic?
report: TNF inhibitors, IL-17 inhibitors, or IL-23 inhibitors based on severity and type.

query: I'm Omar, 59. Diagnosed with type 1 diabetes. What insulin regimen?
report: Multiple daily injections or insulin pump with basal and bolus insulin.

query: My name is Priya, 42. I have hyperthyroidism. What antithyroid medication?
report: Methimazole is first-line; Propylthiouracil in first trimester pregnancy.

query: I'm Qasim, 68. Diagnosed with Waldenström's. What BTK inhibitor?
report: Ibrutinib is used for Waldenström's macroglobulinemia.

query: My name is Rania, 44. I have multiple sclerosis. What DMT first?
report: Interferon-beta, Glatiramer acetate, or newer oral agents based on disease activity.

query: I'm Samir, 61. Diagnosed with gout. What for flare prevention?
report: Colchicine low-dose during initiation of urate-lowering therapy.

query: My name as is Tara, 39. I have endometriosis pain. What progestin?
report: Norethindrone or Dienogest can help control endometriosis pain.

query: I'm Umar, 56. Diagnosed with hepatitis B. What antiviral?
report: Entecavir or Tenofovir are first-line oral antivirals for chronic hepatitis B.

query: My name is Veda, 49. I have cluster headaches. What verapamil dose?
report: Verapamil 240-480mg daily for cluster headache prevention.

query: I'm Waleed, 62. Diagnosed with MGUS. What monitoring?
report: No treatment needed; regular monitoring for progression to myeloma or related conditions.

query: My name is Ximena, 45. I have lichen planus. What topical steroid?
report: High-potency topical corticosteroids like Clobetasol for cutaneous lichen planus.

query: I'm Yusuf, 71. Diagnosed with CLL. What BTK inhibitor?
report: Ibrutinib or Acalabrutinib for certain CLL patients.

query: My name is Zola, 53. I have sarcoidosis. What steroid dose?
report: Prednisone 20-40mg daily initially, tapered to lowest effective dose.

query: I'm Amit, 57. Diagnosed with ITP. What first-line treatment?
report: Corticosteroids like Prednisone or Dexamethasone for immune thrombocytopenia.

query: My name is Bina, 46. I have trigeminal neuralgia. What medication?
report: Carbamazepine is first-line; Oxcarbazepine alternative.

query: I'm Chirag, 64. Diagnosed with myelofibrosis. What JAK inhibitor?
report: Ruxolitinib for symptomatic myelofibrosis.

query: My name is Devi, 51. I have scleroderma. What for Raynaud's?
report: Calcium channel blockers like Nifedipine for Raynaud's phenomenon.

query: I'm Eshan, 58. Diagnosed with ALS. What riluzole dose?
report: Riluzole 50mg twice daily may slow ALS progression.

query: My name as is Farah, 43. I have narcolepsy. What stimulant?
report: Modafinil or Armodafinil first-line; Sodium Oxybate for cataplexy.

query: I'm Gopal, 69. Diagnosed with Paget's disease. What bisphosphonate?
report: Zoledronic acid single infusion often induces long remission.

query: My name is Hina, 47. I have cystitis. What for recurrent UTIs?
report: Postcoital antibiotics or continuous prophylaxis for recurrent UTIs.

query: I'm Indra, 60. Diagnosed with Guillain-Barré. What acute treatment?
report: IVIG or plasma exchange for acute Guillain-Barré syndrome.

query: My name is Jaya, 54. I have Sjögren's. What for dry mouth?
report: Pilocarpine or Cevimeline to stimulate saliva production.

query: I'm Karan, 61. Diagnosed with hemophilia. What factor replacement?
report: Recombinant Factor VIII for hemophilia A; Factor IX for hemophilia B.

query: My name is Leela, 44. I have myasthenia gravis. What pyridostigmine dose?
report: Pyridostigmine 30-60mg every 4-6 hours for myasthenia symptoms.

query: I'm Manoj, 67. Diagnosed with polycythemia vera. What phlebotomy target?
report: Phlebotomy to hematocrit <45% in men, <42% in women.

query: My name as is Nisha, 50. I have cyclic vomiting. What abortive?
report: Sumatriptan or antiemetics like Ondansetron to abort episodes.

query: I'm Omar, 57. Diagnosed with PAH. What endothelin antagonist?
report: Bosentan, Ambrisentan, or Macitentan for pulmonary arterial hypertension.

query: My name is Pooja, 52. I have IIH. What acetazolamide dose?
report: Acetazolamide 1-4g daily in divided doses for idiopathic intracranial hypertension.

query: I'm Qadir, 65. Diagnosed with Wilson's. What chelator?
report: D-penicillamine or Trientine for copper chelation in Wilson's disease.

query: My name is Rani, 48. I have MCAS. What mast cell stabilizer?
